pageProps.title: Can Ketogenic Diet (Keto) Reverse Kidney Disease?
pageProps.metaDesc:
High levels of glucose and insulin create oxidative damage to four tissues: the brain and nerve tissue. The kidney is very susceptible to oxidative damage from high blood sugar and high insulin. Using the ketogenic diet, beta hydroxybutyrate, which is a ketone, can provide an alternative fuel, but it has some real interesting benefits to the kidney.
There's different stages of damage to the kidney, Stage 1 to 5, Stage 5, which is end stage renal failure. In this stage, the kidney can no longer filter anymore, can't filter the blood. Potassium can actually protect the kidney against damage, and we need 4700 milligrams every day.
 You're getting edema, and taking certain oral amino acids can slow down the progression of kidney damage. There are certain types of foods that you're going to have to avoid. If you're already at stage five, try to follow a healthy keto plan and intermittent fasting.
